required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention of PNX and Haemorrhagic Complications in Diagnostic Percutaneous Lung Biopsy Using the MIPP-Kit Device
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study on the Prevention of PNX (Pneumothorax) and Haemorrhagic Complications in Diagnostic Percutaneous Lung Biopsy Procedures Using the MIPP-Kit Device.

brief_summary.textblock: The study will assess the safety and feasibility of a new medical device, MIPP-Kit, for the prevention of complications during diagnostic, CT guided ,percutaneous lung needle biopsy.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of complications associated with percutaneous lung biopsy
primary_outcome.description: incidence of clinical complications commonly associated with lung biopsy (pneumothorax and haemorrhage)

clinical_study.condition: Complications in Diagnostic Percutaneous Lung Biopsy Procedures

intervention.description: Patients will undergo the usual biopsy procedure with a fine needle inserted through a larger guide needle, under CT guidance; at the end of the biopsy, the MIPP-Kit will be introduced through the same guide needle. The guide needle and the MIPP Kit will be retracted together slowly, whilst injecting BioGlue in appropriate amounts along the whole track, from the lesion to the skin.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical indication for diagnostic percutaneous lung biopsy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant, or breastfeeding patient (Female)
- actively participating in other clinical trials in the previous 30 days
- known allergies to the investigational device components
- comorbidities that preclude undergoing percutaneous lung biopsy procedure
- concomitant treatments that preclude undergoing percutaneous lung biopsy procedure

facility.name: Istituto Tumori Bari Giovanni Paolo II
